result.execSummary:
The defendant Eduardo Vilchis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with case 22CM800.
4 days sentence credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not have contact with Christian B, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the Defendant's probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eduardo Vilchis

records.addlTxt: Per Br 6 - cash bond from 22CM800 to be applied to financial obligations in 22CM554
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

02:42 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Eduardo Vilchis, appeared with Attorney Michael D. Cicchini.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM554/22CM800.   Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved and Attorney Cicchini places the agreement on the record. Sentencing arguments heard.

22CM554: Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions concurrent to case 22M800. No contact with Christian B.. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 4 days sentence credit if revoked. 

22CM800: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, counts 2-3 are dismissed. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions concurrent to case 22CM554. No contact with Christian B.. Any violation of probation shall be reported to the Court within 30 days and at least 30 days prior to the termination of the DE's probation. 2 days sentence credit if revoked. 

Court costs and DNA surcharges ordered. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample, notice in Case 22CM800 given to def. in court. Appeals rights given.

01:49 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Eduardo Vilchis, appeared with Attorney Michael D. Cicchini.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Cicchini states that the matter is resolved, but the DE has Case 22CM800 scheduled on 8/22/22. He is requesting that both cases be heard on the date at the same time. Court removes jury selection from the calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court is no longer available in the AM on 7/13/22 and Atty Cicchini requests a new date as DE is not available in the afternoon. Hearing rescheduled to 8/3/22 at 1:30 PM pending confirmation from Atty Cicchini.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.

02:54 PM  Deputy District Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk: P. Trossen.  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:10 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am. $750  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
